intro: Mitrasacme canescens, commonly known as the hairy mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, white pubescence. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations in tropical environments.
